events.originalText: The European Space Agency lander Philae (artist's impression shown) touched down on 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko, becoming the first spacecraft to land on a comet.
events.subtitle: European Space Agency
events.headline: Philae Lander Makes Historic Landing on Comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko

events.originalText: An explosion in the Shahid Modarres missile base led to the deaths of 17 members of the Revolutionary Guards, including Hassan Tehrani Moghaddam, a key figure in Iran's missile program.
events.subtitle: Bid Kaneh explosion
events.headline: Explosion at Shahid Modarres Base Kills 17 Revolutionary Guards, Including Key Figure

events.originalText: Although the Georgian government declared it illegal, South Ossetia held a referendum on independence, with more than 99 percent of voters in favour of preserving the region's status as a de facto independent state.
events.subtitle: South Ossetia
events.headline: South Ossetia Holds Referendum on Independence Despite Georgian Government Opposition

events.originalText: American Airlines Flight 587 crashed into residential buildings five minutes after takeoff from John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York, killing a total of 265 people.
events.subtitle: American Airlines Flight 587
events.headline: American Airlines Flight 587 Crashes in New York, 265 People Killed

events.originalText: A Saudi Arabian Airlines Boeing 747 and a Kazakhstan Airlines Ilyushin Il-76 collided in mid-air near New Delhi, killing 349 people, the deadliest such collision in history.
events.subtitle: Saudia
events.headline: Deadliest Mid-Air Collision in History Near New Delhi, 349 People Killed

events.originalText: Indonesian forces opened fire on student demonstrators protesting the occupation of East Timor in the capital Dili, killing at least 250 people.
events.subtitle: Santa Cruz massacre
events.headline: Indonesian Forces Open Fire on Protesters in East Timor, 250 Killed

events.originalText: The first episode of Last of the Summer Wine, the longest-running television sitcom in history, premiered on the BBC.
events.subtitle: Last of the Summer Wine
events.headline: Longest-Running TV Sitcom Last of the Summer Wine Premieres on BBC

events.originalText: The Oregon Highway Division unsuccessfully attempted to destroy a rotting beached sperm whale near Florence, Oregon, with dynamite.
events.subtitle: Oregon Department of Transportation
events.headline: Oregon Highway Division Fails to Destroy Beached Sperm Whale with Dynamite

events.originalText: The deadliest tropical cyclone in history made landfall on the coast of East Pakistan (Bangladesh), killing at least 250,000 people.
events.subtitle: 1970 Bhola cyclone
events.headline: Deadliest Tropical Cyclone in History Hits East Pakistan, 250,000 Dead

events.originalText: Former Japanese prime minister Hideki Tojo was sentenced to death for war crimes alongside generals Iwane Matsui, Akira Mutō and Kenji Doihara.
events.subtitle: Hideki Tojo
events.headline: Former Japanese Prime Minister Tojo Sentenced to Death for War Crimes

events.originalText: Sudirman was elected the first commander-in-chief of the Indonesian Armed Forces.
events.subtitle: Sudirman
events.headline: Sudirman Elected First Commander-in-Chief of Indonesian Armed Forces

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Air Force sank the German battleship Tirpitz on the ninth attempt (video featured), killing about 1,000 sailors on board.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal Air Force Sinks German Battleship Tirpitz, 1,000 Sailors Killed

events.originalText: World War II: The Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, the decisive engagement in a series of sea battles between Allied and Japanese forces during the months-long Guadalcanal campaign in the Solomon Islands, began.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Naval Battle of Guadalcanal Begins in Solomon Islands

events.originalText: World War II: Free French forces captured Gabon from Vichy France.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Free French Forces Capture Gabon from Vichy France in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: Soviet foreign minister Vyacheslav Molotov arrived in Berlin to discuss the possibility of the Soviet Union joining the Axis powers.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet Foreign Minister Molotov Arrives in Berlin for Axis Powers Talks

events.originalText: At the request of the Government of Western Australia, the Australian military officially resumed fighting the Great Emu War after their prior withdrawal.
events.subtitle: Government of Western Australia
events.headline: Australian Military Resumes Great Emu War at Western Australia's Request

events.originalText: The British ocean liner SS Vestris sank in the western Atlantic Ocean, killing 111 people.
events.subtitle: Ocean liner
events.headline: British Liner SS Vestris Sinks in Atlantic Ocean, 111 Dead

events.originalText: Eight months after perishing during the ill-fated Terra Nova Expedition, the bodies of Robert Falcon Scott (pictured) and his companions were discovered on the Ross Ice Shelf in Antarctica.
events.subtitle: Terra Nova Expedition
events.headline: Bodies of Robert Falcon Scott and Companions Found in Antarctica

events.originalText: In a referendum, 79 percent of voters opted to keep Norway a monarchy, paving the way for Haakon VII to take the throne.
events.subtitle: 1905 Norwegian monarchy referendum
events.headline: Norwegian Voters Choose to Keep Monarchy, Haakon VII to Take Throne

events.originalText: William Heffelfinger was paid $500 by the Allegheny Athletic Association, becoming the first professional American football player.
events.subtitle: Pudge Heffelfinger
events.headline: William Heffelfinger Becomes First Professional American Football Player

events.originalText: Led by the voivode Basarab I, Wallachian forces defeated the Hungarian army in an ambush at the Battle of Posada.
events.subtitle: Voivode
events.headline: Wallachian Forces Defeat Hungarian Army at Battle of Posada
